description:
This was one of the highlights of my trip to SF!  We stopped in so I could pick up some matcha green tea powder and ended up staying for a tea tasting!  My group of 7 including  an 11 year old loved it!  We tasted about 8 different teas and we all found a favorite.  There is no pressure to buy although a couple of us picked up some tea!  

They have quite the selection and I'm sure you will find something you like.  They can advise tea for any ailment you have!  

Definitely stop in and take a tea break!!
author: Liz K.

description:
Good Tea. Bad customer experience. 

Me and two friends came in here around 5:30pm yesterday. We had a little over an hour before we had to part ways and wanted to spend some time together (I'm visiting from out of town). I was unfamiliar with this establishment but after we sat down the man behind the bar explained that they sell tea to take home and give tastings at the bar. My friend shops there regularly and told us she sits at the bar for hours so we were good to hang out for a bit, but after we were there for around an hour, the man behind the bar got really nasty with us. He came over--clearly very angry--and said with venom: "It's really hard to explain the tea while you are sitting over here talking! We are not a cafe where people sit and hang out!" At this point there were about 15-20 people sitting a long the bar and there was a general chatter of conversation throughout the place and we were talking and laughing in normal voices. We had absolutely no idea we were doing anything wrong. It was jarring and upsetting to be handled so aggressively. We are respectful people and if he had said something earlier in a nice way, like: "hey guys would you mind talking quietly so I can explain the tea." Or "hey guys we generally prefer people to only sit her for 15-20 minutes." We would have immediately and respectfully obliged. But this man said nothing until he angrily blew up at us. I had been planning on buying tea as a gift to take home, but instead I felt chased out by a man full of vitriol.
author: Tara T.

description:
EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE & TEA!

I've never had a tea tasting before. What an amazing experience. The owner was so welcoming and knowledgeable about the different teas and the health benefits of each one. He was very funny too. There was quite a few of us. My inlaws, my husband, my 2 kids and he just kept pouring the teas. I can see this as a tea lovers heaven. 

This was a very cool experience and I will definitely be visiting his other establishments.
author: Kris K.

description: I absolutely love this place. I was always skeptical about about going to these places but wow the tea here is so good. The owner is so nice and interesting. Tea tasting really got me. I ended up buying quarter pound of the ginseng green tea. I was hungover when I tried it and I felt a lot better after lol. I highly recommend the ginseng teas for the drinkers out there
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Free tastings of tea from a knowledgeable tea master? YES PLEASE.  I sat here by myself and got fantastic service.  I could tell that the staff member helping me was absolutely obsessed with tea and was so eager to tell me what he knew.  No pretension about it, just genuinely a nice guy who loves tea.  He was super welcoming as well so it was easy to buy tea from him.

I've been hesitant to buy expensive tea from places like this and the tea tastings is the way to go.
author: Brandon B.

description:
Clearly, from what I was told by the woman pouring and serving us, tea really is vital in sustaining our health.  While being offered a taste of almost every tea in the shop, we were told that each one had it's health benefits...and from the sound of it, drinking tea could cure just about any old ailment you may have.  Next time I get that achy breaky feeling, I'll make sure to break out the tea that I bought from Vital Tea Leaf.

Though I ended up buying the Jasmine silver needle tea, I was seriously considering some of the others that we tried such as the Oolong and peppermint tea.  If likely have bought more than one tea had I been willing to spend a little more money.  However, I chose my favorite one (I would reccommend the Jasmine silver needle tea to anyone), but I feel reassured that I can go on-line and order whatever tea I desire and have it shipped to me here in Chicago!!!

The average price of the tea is around  $20, though you can find some pretty pricy ones.  Before you make your decision however, sit down and try some - the lady who helped us was so friendly and eager to have us try the different flavors.  Point one out that you want to try, and they'll steep it right in front of you.  The lovely lady also provided us with a short lesson in the proper way to clean and steep tea!  Turns out, I've been doing it wrong all along.

I walked away from Chinatown that day with the knowledge of how to make my new obsession: Jasmine tea!  Thank you, Vital Tea Leaf.  I'll be ordering more when I run out!
author: Lauren K.

description:
I have a friend in Alaska who has a hard time selecting tea, he likes to do it in person, and that makes it somewhat difficult logistically.

Walking around Chinatown, checked out the store because it looked clean and well presented from the street.  The shelves were completely devoid of dust, it was well lit and Herman was very helpful, even offering to brew a specific cup just so I could taste it.

Called my friend and he requested a 1/4 lb of Monkey Picked Oolong ($40.00).  Sent it up to him and he was EXTREMELY pleased.

If in a need for tea, and back in San Francisco, I would not hesitate to buy from this shop.
author: Steven G.

description:
You walk in and the walls are lined with various teas. Sit down. The workers will walk you through free tastings of potential tea to purchase. I always walk out with at least three bags and am excited to try something new. 

I'm a loyal customer and live in L.A. so this is a must stop while visiting San Francisco. If I cannot make it up there and run-out they have an online store. If they don't have the tea you know and love, call them. They'll go out of their way to make sure you're stalked up year-round. 

Recommendations: iron goddess king, milk oolong, silver needle jasmine
author: Alicia G.

description: this is  what I call friendly service, we were served different tea with proper explanation of the tea you are tasting,  You are not forced to buy anything, very relaxing and great  experience for my family.  Did one Tea ceremony in Shanghai last year and it was memorable.  The owner served us
author: Evelyn K.

description: I have always had an interest in tea, but it is hard to decide where to start since there are so many options. Vital Tea Leaf knows how to get people interested in the age old art and science of tea. They are extremely friendly, knowledgeable and entertaining. Even if you do not like tea, I recommend walking into this place and giving them a shot. You are going to walk out with at least a couple bags of tea. There is no pressure to buy anything. Just good vibes. PS: Get your website back up and running, I want to order more tea from  you!
author: Marcel V.

description:
This was the last stop on my Chinatown Food Tour and it was the best stop.  The nice lady let us taste quite a few teas of different types and flavors, instructing us on the way to rinse the tea, the best temperature of the water, and the best way to steep it.  I wound up buying two of the teas and her recommended two part steeper.  

I've been enjoying the Angel Green and Blue People Ginseng Oolong immensely and will probably be ordering more,like the fantastic rose she started us out with.
author: Kirsten S.

description:
Buying tea here is an experience itself, and I had a great time. 

We tasted several teas before we decided which one to buy. They were all delicious and Royal, the guy who helped me, was happy to teach me about the teas, their history, how to brew them, and more. He was extremely friendly and helpful. 

I will definitely encourage people to come here, taste teas, and buy some. It was a lot of fun.
author: Aiden S.

description: The owner and i'm guessing his wife are half tea-ologist and the other half entertainers. Each tea has specific properties and you buy different ones for certain problems you may have ie: detoxing, complexion, indigestion. If you didn't know a lick of anything about tea and you sat in that tea shop sampling all the different teas then you will probably be an expert lol! Bought a tea set and 1/4 lb of 2 detoxing teas! Great people and very knowledgable
author: Pu B.

description: It was one of the best one man shows ever ! Uncle Gee is fantastic. The staff - patient, professional ,knowledgeable . You get to try any tee for free. ( we were a family of 4 and asked for quite a few teas to sample ) . Of course , teas are not cheap . But what good product is . And that being said the staff will make sure you get what you really want and need . As we did . Than you !
author: Kristina K.

description: We had a really nice tea tasting here at Vital Tea Leaf. The owner was very friendly and offered to let us try just about any kind of tea we wanted. What was really nice was that he also provided lots of information about the health benefits of each type of tea and taught us the difference between how much each is roasted.
author: F H.

description: Knowledgeable staff. Take advantage of tea tasting - a great experience. I ended up buying 2 teas. Great iron goddess tea! Better than anything from amazon.
author: Rose Q.

description: Do yourself a favor and get schooled on tea. I learned so much in a short period of time. Staff is knowledgeable, fun and accommodating. High end accessories. Hopefully "Uncle" is there to add some life wisdom. Fantastic experience!
author: Sara M.

description: Cool place.  Gave us plenty of samples and the story behind each flavor.   Give it a try when you are in Chinatown.
author: Steve M.

description: Best tea I've ever had and the best experience in San Fransisco.  If you're going to Chinatown I recommend dropping in.
author: Candace C.

description: Free tasting of tea, very knowledgeable about teas. Very welcoming! Glad we came upon this tea shop!! Would definitely come back, by far the best tea shop!!!
author: Jun L.

description: I rarely do reviews on anything! If you're ever in San Fran and want quality tea , an amazing tasting with a wonderful & knowledgeable host (hunter) hit up vital tea
author: Gina F.

description:
A highlight of our trip to San Francisco. I drug my family in because tea is totally my thing but not necessarily my family's. They had as good of a time as I did. We tasted green, herbal, red cake, and white.

While tasting, our guide Hunter, entertained and educated us. We ended up buying the red cake tea for digestion, an oolong tea (blue people ginseng) and a chrysanthemum herbal tea.

As we were leaving, Gee the owner, asked my daughter what her favorite fruit was. We walked away with a complimentary quarter lb of strawberry black tea.

Definitely bookmark this place for your visit. We will be back!
author: Colleen B.

description: Wow, such an amazing experience! Hunter (the man working the counter) was incredibly knowledgeable about all the teas and herbs, and gave a lively and interesting tea tasting! We tried maybe a dozen teas/herbs before shopping in the store. Walked out with lots of new loose leaf teas for our growing collection! Excellent service, educational experience. Highly recommend!
author: Ashley C.

description: Best experience! Popped in on Christmas Day. The guy working was so pleasant and beyond helpful. He made really went out of his way, and had us try some of the teas. Wish I could of purchased more but ended up with Ginger Pine for my migraines and Siberian Rose for skin. Loving my teas and wish I could go back. Was visiting.
author: Summer C.

description: I always love tea tasting here whenever I have a family member or friend in town. I always learn something new here each time. Maggie is the best of all of the hosts and the most knowledgeable. I'm very impressed with the quality of tea as well.
author: Xavier W.

description: I was fortunate enough to visit this place some years ago with my sister and my cousin. The service was fantastic and the quality of the teas were amazing. I especially enjoyed the blue people ginseng oolong tea. Can't wait to visit here again!
author: Flora P.

description:
Buying tea here is an experience itself, and I had a blast. 
I am really enjoying my Blue People with ginseng powder. Will be back soon.
author: Timothy N.

description: This place was so fun, HUNTER our tea guru was a blast. The store was clean and the guys who work here are very nice. We enjoyed our time here. There was plenty of bar seating and bazillion teas to buy.
author: Becky G.

description: ONE OF THE HIGHLIGHTS OF MY SAN FRANCISCO TRIP! Attention, hidden gem! My boyfriend and I stumbled into this shop on our way to the Golden Gate Cookie Company. We were shocked to see an American guy selling tea in Chinatown, but his knowledge was extensive and damn, he knew his teas! His attitude was infectious and he poured us cups of tea and proceeded to share his knowledge about the use of tea as medicine. He was knowledgeable and friendly and he made us want to stay at the store for as long as we could! Unfortunately our uber arrived- On our way out the gentlemen working told my boyfriend and i to come back in the morning for a hangover tea. There really is a tea for everything! Go here and learn about it.
author: Glory F.

description: Some serious tea making up in here! Had a delightful hour taste testing around 10 different teas. Hunter, my tea master, was great at telling me the benefits of each tea. Ended up buying the Iron Goddess King tea, good for detoxing. Will defineitly be back next time I'm in the city.
author: catherine c.

description: He was very informative,friendly,welcoming answered all of our questions about tea. Shop was cleaned I will come back when I come again to San Francisco
author: Brenda R.

description: I enjoyed this experience of "tea tastings" more than my wine tasting in Wine Country! We spent about 1.5 hours in here. Hunter was the name of the guy helping us and he was very well informed, a great teacher and also funny too! We bought teas for ourselves and also tea and accessories as our souvenir/gifts for family back home. I'm sure we will be ordering more. Thank you for the amazing time!
author: Jen B.

description: Had a great tea tasting with Hunter today. We came in with a particular tea we liked, and he walked us through a handful of similar teas and talked about the health benefits of each. Looking forward to coming back and introducing others to this place. Thanks, Hunter!
author: David R.

description: Enjoyed the complimentary tea tastings here and learning about the different teas as well. The pourers are very polite and knowledgeable. This is a must when visiting Chinatown!
author: Amy V.

description: Hunter is amazing -- very knowledgeable, very patient, very upbeat. If you catch them when the store isn't busy, you can taste literally dozens of teas before making a choice. Their smallest size for purchase is pretty large, so you have to spend ~$15-20 minimum to take anything home. But overall it's a very highly recommended experience.
author: J S.

description:
We stumbled upon Vital Tea Leaf completely on accident while wandering Chinatown. And good thing too because we must have spent an hour or two in there tasting various teas and learning about them. It was such a phenomenal yet simple experience wholly focused on the tea. Though the entire tea tasting was free with zero pressure to purchase, we ended up buying a lot because we were sold on both taste and health benefits. 

Definitely, definitely recommend this to locals and tourists alike! Next time I'm back in San Francisco, I will, without a doubt, make a second visit.

((Just realized I actually visited the 509 Grant Ave location and not the 1044 Grant Ave location))
author: Claire H.

description:
Probably the coolest Chinatown experience I could have had. I was getting myself lost and wondering around after a hectic New Year when I stumbled into this hidden treasure. The tea master was giving a free tasting for anyone who was walking in but it wasn't just a tasting, he was a show himself. He educated everyone about the tea they were drinking along with had stories to tell that went along with each tea. He also is a Kung foo master! The teas were phenomenal. Then when i tired to tip the guy he didn't want to accept it. He truly just loves tea! I felt like i walked into a magical tea shop, the kind of magic you hope to find when you visit quirky San Francisco. This spot is a must for any tea lover and or lover of romantic San Francisco.

Question: if Vital ends up reading this review. I tasted a tea that the Queen of England drinks. It was so good and regret not getting it. I think it might have been a red tea. Would love to learn what it was so I can order it!
author: G M.

description: This is as Good as it Gets!  Uncle Gee is the Best.  He inspires my son to be the best that he can be every time we come and visit.  He is genuinely concerned about my son and how he is doing academically in school and in the world.  He is a phenomenal person and the best Uncle ever! Oh and the tea is the best and highest quality when it comes to high end teas.  I highly recommend stopping in for some tea and some life coaching from Uncle Gee!
author: Ellen V.

description: Excellent place! Welcoming and knowledgeable staff.  Found it by accident in Chinatown, would go back for sure.
author: T E.

description: Free tea tasting from a knowledgeable tea maker. Best tea tasting experience in my life so far.
author: Margaux C.

description:
Great place for tea! Everyone time I come to the Bay I usually come here just to visit this place and buy my tea haha. Yeah, plus it's fun to sit and chat with the people there about the different teas they have. They will give you free samples and if you want you can buy their tea. I usually buy a bag or two every time I come down. The staff is friendly and very inviting. They also have tea sets and accessories for sale at the shop. It is a good selection and can take care of your tea needs. 

Unfortunately, they do not have parking near by so you will have to huff it down to this location. If you can find parking near by on one of the meters good luck with that. But you also get to walk around the busy streets of San Francisco. Uncle Gee is awesome. I love it when he presents and just yells and talks about tea haha. He cracks me up. He is one of the reasons why I like this tea shop. 

They do make it a cool visit every time I come here. Also if you know what you want you can skip the tasting of the samples by why would you ever want to do that Haha? You can be in and out of here pretty quickly if you just want to grab your tea to go. The staff usually gets you out especially if you in a hurry. I thank you for reading my review.
author: Perfecto M.

description: Hunter was extremely knowledgeable and helped me pick out a set (gaiwan and all) that would be good to start my own tea journey.  Not only did he talk about the pros and cons of different pieces, but he also gave me some usage tips!  The end price didn't break the bank either.  I ended up doing some tasting which was fun and helped me figure out what to experiment with my purchase.  While I've got my hardware now, I'll definitely be back for more tastings and tea purchases.
author: Jonathan D.

description:
The saleswoman there (I believe her name was Maggie) is very informative. She can suggest a tea for whatever problems or concerns you have and she'll tell you the benefits along with pros and cons of certain teas. She's very informative and she's very engaging with everyone sitting by the tea tasting bar. 

I love that you can try the teas here-- any tea you've been thinking of and they'll brew it in front of you. This place sells loose tea leafs, which is better and they have a lot of accessories in the back too. Definitely try out some teas here before you make a purchase because you'll probably discover something you've never had the chance to try before!!
author: Susan S.

description:
I absolutely loved this place. It was such a welcome respite from the hustle outside, on the streets of Chinatown. We found it completely by accident and decided to stop in for a bit.

A very nice young gentleman was working and offered us a tasting of various types of teas. He was very knowledgeable. All were good, but my favorite was the roasted rice green tea. I bought a bag to bring home and I've been drinking it every day.

It was just very relaxing to sit and enjoy some hot tea after a very long day of running all over the city sightseeing. In fact, I enjoyed it so much, that when I got home to Houston, I researched to find a similar place to go and enjoy tea tastings.

If I'm ever in San Francisco again, I will definitely return to this store.
author: Kellie M.

description: Awesome free tea tasting experience with an educated host. Prices for tea and materials are great!
author: Kayla G.

description: Tea tasting here is an experience all on its own. Kenny shoots straight and tells you exactly what each tea offers, how it's picked and prepared. He is VERY knowlegable! The prices vary from inexpensive to EXTREAMLY expensive. Tell Kenny what you're looking for and how much you want to spend, he will take care of you! I can't wait to come back and shop in the store again!
author: Cynthia C.

description: Wow.....a must stop off when in the city and in China Town. It is tea tasting in the style of wine tasting with out the tasting charge. The people are funny and very informative about the benefits of tea and all they have. We brought family who were visiting from West Virginia we all had a great time. Everyone went home with wonderful tea. So many great tasting teas. I tasted a root tea, Ox Root, that was a little earthy I now use it in the pot as I cook brown rice it is amazing.....I just removing it when the rice is done. The rose tea is so good...no caffeine so great for evening time tea. Vital Tea Leaf tea's are now being enjoyed in West Virginia. Stop by you will not forget your experience.
author: Steve F.

description: Stumbled upon this wonderful tea shop where the owner sat us down for a free tasting which ended up being like an amazing class on tea. One of our favorite parts of our vacation and definitely a place that deserves a stop when you're in China Town.
author: Sam L.

description: The lady who helped us with the tea selection process was extremely helpful and knowledgeable about her wares. I noticed before that she was patient with her former clients doing a taste test. Maybe when I come back to try tea, this will be the place to go.
author: David S.

description:
If you love tea, then you need to come here. This place gives you free tea tastings! The Chinese gentleman helping my wife and I was extremely helpful and funny. He let us try several types of tea, including: red mint, jasmine, green tea, and a few more with challenging names I can't even remember. 

If you are looking for tea that will help with a cold, sinuses, digestion, or balance, he will give you a straightforward recommendation on what is best.  You can tell the tea leaves are high quality by the smells and tastes of the different varieties. If you're ever walking through Chinatown, just stop in for 10 minutes and enjoy yourself.
author: Michael S.

description: We came in for some free tea. The server was extremely intelligent about what he was selling and you could tell that he cared about it too! Each cup was delicious. He had an answer for every question we had and could fit any tea with anything you're in need for. Came out with the blue people ginseng oolong . Delicious!
author: Damien A.

description: Most excellent!  Great selection.  HUNTER was a knowledgeable and delightful tea guide. Filled our green bag with lots of goodies. Thank you
author: C S.

description: Mey and Uncle Gee are super nice! I ended up getting the premium iron goddess grean tea! perfect to complement sushi & some dimsum. come stop by
author: Taryn M.

description:
I thoroughly enjoyed buying from this establishment.  An American gentleman selling tea In Chinatown?  Well, he knows his stuff.  I wanted a tea which he couldn't find.  So he called the owner and then the owner showed up.  They let you taste any tea that you wanted and were generous in sharing and allowing you to taste test.

Them being so nice I bought a lot of great teas.  They really know their teas and I left purchasing a lot. I left as a very happy consumer.  Can't wait to drink my teas!
author: Joseph Y.

description:
Saw a sign for free tasting and walked in. The owner was welcoming and had us sit down. He walked us through proper preparation and the health benefits of different teas. The teas were delicious. This is "Napa" for tea tastings. Walked out with four teas and a tea press. Can't wait to start medicating with tea when I get home! 
Do yourself a favor and go sit here for half an hour. Open your mind and palate to the multitude of delicious teas!
author: Terrell B.

description: Great place for tea tasting...they educated about tea in general and the stuff we bought from there was good quality too.
author: Jay D.

description: Ended up at this free tea tasting after a walking food tour of Chinatown.  The owner was great at explain the difference of teas around the world and how best to prepare them and how to avoid common tea mistakes.  He was very, very entertaining -- the tasting and education was like watching a one man play. Really fun and entertaining in itself!! Go with some friends and try it. You'll have a lot of fun.
author: Keith F.

description: Amazing place with knowledgable staff. This is definitely not a tourist trap at all. Free tea tastings!
author: Bryan Y.

description:
We wandered in because we were curious about all the teas that were on display and ended up being welcomed to sit down and enjoy a complimentary tea tasting. This experience was very educational and informative. I learned a lot about loose leaf teas and was very pleased with all of the samples we tried. I requested a tea that would be good for boosting the immune system and was given a sample of green angel. I ended up buying a canister of it because I enjoyed it so much. Our lovely tea maker even included a tea strainer for free with my tea purchase. She was very knowledgable and enjoyable to learn from. I wish I would have gotten her name, but all staff at Vital Tea Leaf seem equally friendly, helpful and knowledgable. I have been brewing my green angel every day and will be back to buy some more tea soon!

This would be a cool experience as an SF local or tourist walking through Chinatown and it costs nothing! Wander in and be delighted by all the teas like we were. I dare you.
author: Taryn S.

description: The owners here make it fun to drink tea. Im already a fan of tea and drink it on a daily basis but it's always great to discover new things in a raucous setting. Ive come to learn that this is where M.Y. China gets all of it's teas too and the Milk Oolong is particularly good. Iron Goddess, and some of the others are also tasty. I'd say go down and give them a try, it's totally worth it. 4.3 stars
author: Kim N.

description:
Edit: this shop has a few stores. After a bad experience at one of them (see below), I went into another one (a few blocks away on Grant St.), where May and Chris welcomed me very friendly and gave me an INCREDIBLE tasting experience - dozens of amazing teas including sweet oolongs, nutty white teas and apricot-tasting red tea. A real treat. I ended up dropping more $$$ than I intended, but it was well worth it. 

Basically - a wonderful place, but you definitely want to go to the store near the corner of Grant and Pine.

------- here's what I had originally written about the experience at the first store:--------

The younger employee at this place is a rude, arrogant and pretentious snob. It's a pity because this place could be a gem that helps people discover great loose leaf tea. 

I'm a huge tea drinker, to the point of traveling to find the best teas, but couldn't bring myself to stay in here for more than two minutes because of this guy's unbearable rudeness to every customer. 

Tea is an intimidating beverage as it is - you have to be friendly and accommodating with people in order to make it accessible. I'm sure this guy is very knowledgeable, but what good does it do if you're going to turn everyone off with your attitude? Ugh.
author: Federico P.

description: Visiting this tea shop was one of the highlights of our trip to SF!  It is a beautiful store with endless varieties of tea.  But what is really special is the experience you have while you're there.  Hunter, our tea specialist, was so welcoming and invited us to try many kinds of tea.  We learned so much from him.  It was a thoroughly enjoyable visit!  Don't miss it!
author: Kate S.

description: Until last weekend, this is was a destination stop to bring friends visiting SF. Both gentleman there are so fun, gracious - best of all, I learned so much about tea. For that reason, I bought a lot of teas every time I went.  So did my friends.  The education was great - a great way to know more about one of my passions. Same way I learn about wines... I now have a whole cabinet devoted to tea and tea paraphernalia because of it. THEN, last Saturday I made a special trip to the city with a visiting friend, there was a women who was offended by my expectation of the same experience. I tried explaining previous experiences.She told me rudely that "she is not like the 'others' who allow people to taste and I better tell her what I want if I expect to taste anything." My visiting friend was disgusted, mostly at the nastiness of her tone.  After a couple of attempts to taste, we left.  This was a fav place in SF - lots to do, of course, in SF, but it's too bad about Vital Tea Leaf.  Not sure I will take the risk of running into her again - even though the guys were awesome.  But.... darn it!
author: Ellen B.

description:
Service is very friendly! They were eager and giving with their tea samples with us as we walked in the door and sat in 

They also are very knowledgeable of their teas and were very open to questions and teaching us a lot about the history of the teas that we were interested in! 

Prices are pretty decent with hundreds of teas! They're all in big glass jars and you can see exactly what the tea leaves or the tea buds or seeds are coming from!!! 

They also sell a lot of teapots too which are kinda cute but too Asian for me :)
Will come back here for more teas for sure!!

Favorite teas:
-Snow chrysanthemum 
-Monkey picked green tea (absolutely my favorite and it's for cleansing your body)
-Lychee black tea 
-Jasmine green tea
author: Cuc N.

description:
As we were walking in Chinatown, we noticed a sign that said "free tea tasting." We thought we were going to just run in, grab some samples in plastic cups sitting on a table and run out. Boy, were we wrong!

You sit down at the bar as a tea expert serves you four or five various kinds of tea and explains exactly the real way it should be brewed (not the tea bag American way of drinking tea). Royale (I believe his name was) was so friendly, charismatic and charming. You can definitely tell he loves giving people the knowledge on tea and has a passion for the drink. 

We didn't buy anything, but we tooks some business cards to hopefully order things online in the future!
author: Aj S.

description: Amazing experience. Came here expecting to be out in 10 minutes. Stayed here for an hour drinking different teas. Prime sf experience
author: Eric N.

description:
We were looking for a tea house to sit and enjoy some tea and conversation.  

I found Vital leaf and we went inside. It wasn't what we were expecting. This wasn't a traditional tea house, but a place where you could sample teas before buying them.  And that's Ok.  We felt welcome and comfortable as we sat at the bar and were offered several different tastes of different teas. They started with an oolong, a traditional black tea and then started with the different whites and other leaf teas.  

In the end, we left with a purah (?) tea and a milk oolong, they were expensive but good quality. I am certain that we will be back before we leave.
author: Dianna B.

description: This china town tea shop was a fabulous experience! We received free tastings and went home to San Diego with an authentic teapot and many kinds of loose tea. We are so hooked that two years later we still order regularly off the website. Absolutely delicious!
author: Janelle B.

description:
One of my go-to places for really good loose tea, this location is right in the middle of it all in Chinatown. The older gentleman that hocks the tea, Uncle Gee, has funny stories and anecdotes. The younger gentleman has consistently been really helpful. I always leave with a box of Blue People Gingseng Oolong. It has this sweet lingering taste after you drink that I absolutely love and it's also supposed to be a coffee replacement. Another tea I like getting is the Lychee Rooibos which is a sweet red tea that's good for digestion & has lots of antioxidants. 

You don't have to buy by the lb, so don't feel pressured into anything. And they will try to push the expensive teas. Just ask for samples if you're uncertain about the flavor of a tea.
author: Kitty K.

description:
Did a "tea crawl" or most of the local tea shops in SF a couple of weeks ago. We included Tokyo Tea & Futon, Red Blossom, Ten Ren, Aroma, Song Tea & Ceramics, and Vital Tea Leaf. Both my friend and I enjoyed Vital Tea Leaf the best. Very friendly staff, an excellent selection of teas, and generous tastings. 

Vital Tea Leaf appears to be all about the tastings. You saunter up to a long "tea bar" filled with patrons, and the teatenders behind the bar are brewing away in a selection of gaiwans. We asked to try several teas, and also tried quite a few of the teas that were being prepared by the other customers. Our teatender was very enthusiastic about tea and loved to discuss the subtleties. I hope to return soon. 

We also enjoyed the other tearooms and tea stores mentioned above, but Vital Tea Leaf seemed really special.
author: Raoul D.

description: Very entertaining tea tasting and presentation by Uncle Gee. If you are bored and would like a temproary panacea to your troubles, visit Vital Tea and listen to Uncle Gee share his life story (raised by a Tiger Mom) and describe the process of making and drinking tea. No iced tea! He swears by pu-eerh tea for weight loss and green tea as an appetite suppressant. Tea place with a lot of offerings. Recommended.
author: Kitty D.

description:
This place was the highlight of my chinatown trip to SF. 

While it was raining outside a friend wanted to get some tea. The store is lined with os many types of teas, in which pounds are sold for hundreds. The man was going to close, but then he sat us down for a "Tea tasting" what followed was a herd of people over a $1000 in sales, and getting to taste 20 types of teas.

Their main approach is "tea is for your health, not taste" which is something that I Agree with. The rose tea was my favorite as as the lychee white tea. However, I bought the Angel Green due to it's detoxing principles. 

Super friendly service, he taught us how to write shorthand Chinese, we found out about where he was from, he spoke 5 languages,jokes were cracked and overall a very pleasant experience. Love this place.
author: Casie N.

description: Excellent tea, free tasting, refreshing and relaxed atmosphere. I learned a lot about how tea is made. The health spiel I got while tasting the tea was from a personable young man with absolutely no knowledge of biology or medicine so I recommend disregarding it. But definitely go and try the tea.
author: K A.

description: Did a tea tasting, and it has started a love for tea for both my husband and I. So informative and we discovered some very good teas.
author: Shannon W.

description: This was my first time visiting San Francisco and we received great service!! Tony was helping us out and he gave us plenty of tea samples to try he was AMAZING!! Ming is the owner and he has a great sense of humor. I will definitely stop by again next time I am in San Francisco
author: Jamie B.

description: This man was chill as it gets and had no problems serving me whatever I asked for, was put on the spot on a livestream to thousands of people and enjoyed it much, very nice person, would recommend.
author: Fred F.

description:
I love tea stores - that's no secret to anyone who knows me.  This one, though, takes the cake for the best.  Stopped in to one of their 3 Chinatown shops and sat down at the tea bar.  Royal helped my mom and I and gave us several teas to try.  He was very knowledgeable about the tea and enthusiastic about sharing that knowledge with customers.  I took home two new teas, and will definitely be going back to Vital Tea Leaf when I'm in San Francisco next year!  

The shop has a huge variety of teas and they'll let you try any of them that you want to.  They'll also give you instruction on properly brewing the tea, how many steeps its good for, and so on.  If you're in Chinatown (or Seattle - I've been to their store there as well), and you like good tea, stop in and say howdy to the people working at Vital Tea Leaf.
author: Sara R.

description: OMG!!  Could the guy working the tea bar here be any ruder?  Just went in to look around with my niece, who's from out of town. Asked about the teas and if we could have a pot, similar to the tea shop in the Ferry Building. This guy, half Asian, was so belligerent. He said, "NO. This isn't a Starbucks. ". Lordie!  Please get another job if you can't deal with tourist questions. Back to the Ferry Building for us.
author: Corn D.

description:
Does this place even need another 5 star rating?  I don't think I need to reiterate how entertaining, fun, educational, and tasty the tea tasting went.  We were given multiple teas to try, and I'm pretty sure we almost bought a pound of each.  We spent over an hour just hanging out in there with the staff.  My husband and I were visiting a close friend of his who lives in SF, and apparently he was such a regular at this place that one of the staff members who happened to also be walking around in town recognized our buddy and invited him over.  We were already on our way there, but it was such a pleasant surprise that he recognized our friend.  It was as if we were going over to a friend's place for some afternoon tea!

All in all, you can't go wrong with this tea house.  I know there are so many other ones to be tempted to go into, but you truly get an authentic, warm, and educational experience when you are here.  A++ service...I selfishly wish these guys are on the east coast instead!!
author: Tina L.

description:
Very bad experience!! There was a younger guy, Chris, that was very rude (half asian-half caucasian). I was looking at some of the teas on the top shelf and asked a worker and he said to take the lid off first and it was fine. Kenny walked up and said you cannot do that since people drop them. I said that the other worker said it was fine and he said, "well then that's different." in very rude tone. Next I was tasting teas and my back was very sore so I was standing up. Kenny said, "sit down, I do not serve to people standing up" in a very rude tone again. I told him that my back was sore and he did not say anything. It is amazing that they let people like that continue to work in their store.

I really enjoy Chinese teas but this place really pissed me off. We went to the other Vital Leaf on 904 Grant Street and had a much better experience with customer service.
author: Jon J.

description:
Free tea sampling of dozens of varieties of top-notch teas..... what do you have to lose? (You might even get a new uncle for free too). This is a great spot for groups, families, a fun date, meeting cool strangers, etc (basically for any occasion). 

When you sit down at the tea bar you will have an endlessly refilling glass of tea. You will cycle though a wide variety of teas all while being entertained with jokes and tea facts (and interesting conversations if you come on the right day). After returning a dozen or so times, I still learn something new each time. You will no doubt find your new favorite tea (but if you don't, it's cool, there is no pressure to buy after you try!) 

My favorite is the Ginseng Oolong, the Blue Tea and Siberian Roses. Each has its own unique taste and properties. I also really like the Milk Oolong (it has a buttery aftertaste to it!). I have tried and purchased many kinds and they are all very high quality. All the varieties last 3-4 brews (and some more than 5). A scoop of leaves can last all day tea making.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Vital Tealeaf is an incredible tea adventure.  SIP, LAUGH & LEARN.

Disclosure: Okay I love tea.  I just spent a month in Paris visiting relatives & drinking divine infusions. I came home with a suitcase full of fine teas from places like: Mariage Feres, Kusmi, Laduree, Dammann Feres & LePalais des Tha.  So I know my Chai. - But in all my travels I have never come across a more unique tea experience than the one I had here.

This unassuming place caught my eye as I was walking around in Chinatown.  The minute I stepped inside I knew I was in the hands of experts.  Like all good tea shops the walls were lined with loose leaf tea canisters but the similarities end there.  My friend & I are invited to sit & taste some teas.  A tea education is served with every cup.  An exotic woman explains how each tea is grown, stored, brewed & enjoyed with detailed explanations of the health benefits of every infusion.  But this tea expert doesn't just brew separate pots.  She demystifies Asian tea culture with the wit of a serious comedian.  We sip & laugh & learn.  

A few minutes after our 2nd taste later a small group arrives.  They turn out to be visitors on a gastronomic tour of San Francisco.  Everyone delights in the adventure.  After learning all about the different health benefits associated with Vital Teas, I will never experience tea the same way.

I truly urge you to stop in & try this place.  It is quite an amazing adventure.
author: Ann P.

description: Amazing! Tea tasting, tea tutorial, staff has so much knowledge about brewing, drinking and storing your tea. Did you know you have to rinse your tea leaves? And did you know that you can te-use your tea 8 times!?!?! Better after first use. I had no idea till now. So impressed and glad I came in.
author: Sona G.

description:
Uncle Gee is my hero!  - I have a new "must do" to places to add to a visitor tour of San Francisco - the education on tea is great but the real show is Uncle Gee.
I took home a great assortment of teas and am anxious to apply all that I learned to my daily rituals.
author: Mark C.

description: Uncle Gee made us feel right at home. My wife's coworker asked for some tea from this shop so we stopped by for a taste. Uncle explained you don't drink for the smell but for its benefits. I went with my wife, my Mother and my two Aunts and he was asking them to touch his face to see how soft his skin was. I am coffee drinker and will be drinking more tea which is better for you.
author: Hugo C.

description:
This is a wonderful, cozy tea shop in China Town. It's great little place for all tea lovers and tea-loving tourists. My colleague and I popped in here last week for tea sampling lessons, and we really enjoyed our time. 

I'm a tea drinker, so I was immediately drawn to this place. We sat here and sampled the different types of teas that our host presented. We learned that there is no such thing as decaf tea. All teas have caffeine and the ones that have been stripped off caffeine has chemicals in them, and no longer pure. When I asked about lavender and chamomile teas, he corrected me and said that they were flowers and not teas. There's a difference. 

We also learned that adding sweeteners like milk and sugar loses its health benefits. That is part of the British and American culture Chemically processed substances like sugar are not ideal for consumption when you are trying to detox. 

Teas have healing properties, and it defeats the purpose of detoxifying if you put sugar and milk in them. Staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. 
This place is also great for gifts. You can find all kinds of teaphernalia and accessories here. I love it.
author: Michael F.

description: Michael and I were wandering around Chinatown when we spotted this place. There were a lot of people inside sampling tea from tiny cups. We were intrigued. We love tea and we're looking to buy some more. We came in and sat down and were immediately poured whatever the group was sampling. This place is the wine tasting of tea. Patrick(I believe was his name) gave us an overview of tea and how they make tea. I learned so much about tea which made me really excited. We tried a few different kinds of tea and settled on a green tea. Don't go there expecting to get tea bags I'm pretty sure you will be thrown out. Only loose leave here. Only thing I would have to say is that we definitely over paid for our tea but hey it was a good experience and they gave us a lot of tea to sample.
author: Jess H.

description:
I dragged my boyfriend here when he wasn't much of a tea drinker. He said it all tasted like hot water to him with a slightly different taste.

"I guess I should put some grass in hot water then and make money off it..."

It just goes to show that not everyone has as much of a massive tea appreciation as me. I came here stoked on the fact that I get to taste tea for free, being a massive tea fan myself.

Customer Service:
Fantastic! Everyone was friendly and knew their tea. You cannot find that much expertise anywhere else.

Teas:
They have a huge variety of tea ranging from dessert teas to savoury teas. Their shop's walls are lined with every tea you can possibly imagine. My favourite was the Lychee tea, a nice tea with a sweet aftertaste of lychee. Yum!

... My boyfriend still thought that tasted like hot water.

If you want to make a purchase however, the tea is super expensive which is why this spot gets stars off. If they didn't rake customers in with their free tea tasting, they would have a hard time selling their expensive product.
author: Clarissa Y.

description: Nice and helpful employees with a large and premium selection of products. Just keep in mind you are buying top shelf products so you will be paying a high price. I did purchase a few items but was shocked at the price of a few that I tried. Definitely recommend stopping in.
author: Jonah M.

description:
I stumbled upon this hole in the wall (literally) place a few years back, and have gone back ever since. Surprisingly they still remember me even if months have passed by since my last visit, that is when you know they CARE about the customers. I became a huge tea enthusiast because of this place. My first time visiting here, I learned more about tea than I ever did before. It was insane to know there was a world of tea out there that not a lot of know about. This place was extremely informative and really comedic (lets just say the owners/workers are extremely REAL and won't hold stuff back in regards to tea and its drinkers). Every time I go to SF, I always have the urge to visit this store and support them. It's that amazing.

They mainly focus in traditional teas (white, oolong, black, green) way more than flavored and fruity teas. They keep the tradition of tea alive and well.

Word of advice, never go in and ask them if they have Lipton tea or think Teavana is great. They will straight up ignore you and hope you don't come back. Like I said.. REAL.
author: Vu N.

description: Rude, not helpful, and a waste of time. I found out the owner was not there, but unfriendly, uninterested Kenny was. Perhaps a different personality and person would be better. Drink the mood changer, Kenny.
author: Edward P.

description:
I came for the free tea tasting and it was decent but nothing I haven't grown up drinking. Some would call the tea guy charismatic. I found him to be obnoxious. He talks like he learned English from watching Hollywood action movies and has a really aggressive way of teasing you (e.g. "If you don't come in, I'll beat your ass"....verbatim quote). After a while, I just had to leave because I couldn't stand listening to him anymore. 

Skip this place.
author: Josephine L.

description:
Great place to star learning the art of tea!! Maggie, was amazing! She explained everything to us, from how the sources ( plants ) are grown to pricing and storage! 
I will defínetely would recommend VTF to anyone how wants to enlarge or be introduce to teas!
author: Carmen R.

description:
It makes me very sad to feel like I need to write this review. I loved this place.
Went there recently for a completely different experience than in the past.
An older man was putting on the "tea show" for all of the tourists. He said some very inappropriate, embarrassing, and very sexist things, even to the other woman working there.
If you're a young, attractive woman, expect to be objectified, flirted with, and made to feel slightly uncomfortable for 45 minutes in exchange for 3 tiny cups of free tea.
If you're a bit older or less attractive woman, expect to be objectified, humiliated, and publicly shamed for 45 minutes in exchange for 3 tiny cups of free tea.
If you're a man, expect to be ignored.
Unless you're lucky enough to have the girl do the tea tasting show for you - then, expect an informative, welcoming, and truly memorable experience and many delicious tea samples.

Side note: tea is expensive.
author: Ashley O.

description:
This place is not just great but is an institution.
They have every type of Chinese tea there is.
The people there are always friendly and "Uncle" is a no BS person that might be intimidating but don't let him scare you - he wont bite, I promise.
Some might think "Uncle" is too frank but its always with a smile and you will come to appreciate it. Yin and her mother are always there to bring you a taste of tea and never rush you. If you live around the area, you'll be a regular. If you are visiting you must drop by.
Thank you for being a long lasting, friendly, good tasting shop that I will always cherish in SF.
author: Brian F.

description: Such an enjoyable experience! The owner is full of personality, and the tea selection is awesome. Stopped in for five minutes, ended up staying two hours and don't regret a moment of it! Very authentic and unique activity in Chinatown!!
author: Ro A.

description:
Uncle was yelling at me from inside the store and threaten to kick my @$$ if I didnt come in for a drink.

Overall I had an excellent experience was informed how to properly serve and prepare tea. I was doing it all wrong now I know!!!

I got to try most of the tea and learn a lot about it.
If your looking for tea here is where you need to be. 

The products are amazing definitly worth it's price and the knowledge as well.

The story of where the tea come from if even more amazing. This is now my go to tea shop
author: Dylan C.

description: Racist and RUDE! I've never been so mistreated in my LIFE. Sad! Especially because we had children with us. We're from San Diego, my best friend and I came to SF for a mother daughter trip. We were walking through Chinatown buying stuff and sightseeing just like every other tourist. We passed by here, and being that my daughter and I LOVE tea we decided to try it out. It sounded fun! We come in and nobody acknowledges us we sit down at the end. Maybe after 5 minutes the gentleman finally comes and says can I help you. He rudely says "we don't sell cups of tea, sample only, then you buy". Ummm okay. The funny thing was him and this other lady were totally getting into the tea presentations with their guests who were NOT Latina like ourselves. The contrast of service was striking. My friend said oh I want to try the champagne one, he said "you don't drink tea by name" then my friend asked the other lady what she would recommend and liked the best, she responded coldly "you won't like it l, you can't handle it". Ummm okay that's not what we asked! Then I asked the man if there's a tea to help with metabolism and weight loss, he said "exercise". Then he says "in America we don't make talk, Americans don't lie to talk to people". I said well I like to converse. He then brings out a box of bandaids and says he will charge $5.00 to tape it to my mouth for 24 hours so I won't eat if I'm interested in tea that aids in metabolism. He then asks my friend if she's been drinking which she had 1 drink earlier. It was bizarre and awful. Rude! We left. I would have bought the tea had I been treated properly. Please avoid this place! My worst part of my SF trip.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Pros:
-free tasting of several teas.
-Decent selection.
-Overall friendly service.

Cons:
-Little to no information about the teas (can't judge the quality).
-Puerh was called 'black tea', oolong was 'green tea'.  Didn't really care to go into detail to help people learn more.  White lies.
-Staff was constantly pushing 'health benefits' of each tea.  To the point of annoyance.  
-After more people showed up, the tasting turned into almost a comedy show of the guy working there cracking jokes.
-Overpriced

I bought some tea that I liked from the tasting, but immediately went over to Red Blossom where they actually know their stuff and take the effort to expand your knowledge.  Wouldn't go back to vital leaf, but if you just want a casual experience, it's not bad.
author: Tyler H.

description:
I am a tea fanatic and this place is the best invention in time so far. Through the womens magazine and co workers I found out about this place and drove two hours to see if really this tea was as amazing as it sounds. I have had Digestion problems all my life and have tried numerous meds but after 4 days of just changing my coffee habbit to Tea has made a major difference in my digestive system. I actually feel much better knowing something is happening in there instead of my body keeping all the toxins in. 

awesome cheerful Son of Mr Gee attended me and i was blown away by the advices he gave. I have changed a little bit of my eating and drinking habbits like he had suggested and I can see a difference. What he adviced was no joke it makes a difference in the long run of life for longevity. The place to be for Herbal Teas for any problems you are having. I bought the PU ERH Tea for (digestion fat burna nd normal tea drinking)and the BLUE TEA for my insomnea and PMS moods. Both are working really good at this point. My craving for sugar has gone away finally.

TEA LOVERS/HEALTH CONSCIOUS JUNKIES I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE 5 STAR PLUS
author: jotika c.

description:
If Seinfeld had ever done an episode on a "tea guy" it would have been here with this cast of characters.  When asked what tea we wanted to try we were humorously told off for our taste and choices and told to sit and be educated.  The tasting was educational and even indulged with a few of our choices...only to be proved that our taste wasn't refined at all! lol

Wasn't personal at all though - a few others got told off as well after wandering in and asking to try a random tea.  Yes, they push the higher priced tea but it is the better tea.  Overall we enjoyed it.  There are many places offering free tea tasting but I would strongly recommend this one!
author: Denise M.

description:
I really liked this place! The free tea samples are great! They are very knowledgeable and don't push you on buying their tea. 

It is a very nice break from walking around Chinatown. The decoration is very cute and when you sit down to get the tea samples, you get about at least 5-6 samples. 

Tea is a little expensive but you do pay for the experience and can sample everything before buying them.
author: Thuy L.

description: Great customer service and welcoming experience last friday 10/22/16. Knowledgeable on the teas and learned a lot. Wish had ask both of their names (she's Cambodian , his Caucasian (I think) )
author: Shell B.

description: Such a fun experience! They offer free tea tasting! All you have to do is walk in and someone will ask if you want to join. You sit at a long "tea bar" and they'll give you 6 or 7 teas to try in a little 1oz tea cup. They are very informative! I learned so much about tea! It's polite to buy a bag of tea at the end, but they don't pressure you. I found the place to be rather expensive, but the free tasting was very nice. We walked away with a 2 oz bag of herbal jasmine pearl for $10 (about a handful). I would give this place 5 stars because they are so friendly and informative, but -1 for the high prices. If you are a tea consensuar I highly recommend this place!
author: Brittany L.

description: Sit down at the bar, immediately get pours of whatever tea is in rotation, converse rowdily with the tea shop owner, the bowl of tea leaves is passed around between guests to smell, request pours of certain teas, buy some tea, leave happy.
author: Wiley W.

description:
This place is everything I could ever want in a Chinese tea house. The guy running it was very attentive. He let us taste test anything we wanted, and we were there for about an hour! So fun. Highly recommend to any tea lovers.

P.S. The Milk Oolong is my favorite. I drink it daily.
author: Nicolette H.

description:
This is my go-to place for loose leaf tea. I've been here a few times for tastings and sat at that counter for hours. It's a good place to get basic information about tea and I like introducing my friends to this place.

Be warned: they will try to upsell you quite a bit. Prices are listed by the pound so they seem super expensive, but they'll pitch 4 oz to you and it'll feel more reasonable.  But, when you take it home, you realize 4 oz will take forever for you to finish. I suggest that no matter what tea you buy, just ask for 2 oz and it will last you a long time. 

I know a lot of people complain that their prices are high but I disagree. If you compare prices of their loose leaf tea vs. what you pay per ounce in bagged tea, it's not expensive at all. The quality and taste is so much better than the crap in bags too. I drink their stuff almost everyday. No joke.

My favorite green tea from them is Iron Goddess King. I also enjoy their 25 year aged pu-erh.
author: Elsie M.

description:
Quality "real" tea (not Teavana herbal blends) at great prices.

Go for the tea tasting, gain some knowledge of tea, and take some home for yourself!

**Iron Goddess King green will change your opinion on green teas entirely.
author: Jennifer H.

description: This was so much fun. The free tea tasting experience was a blast. Find a free space at the counter and sit back and enjoy!  We learned a lot about tea and our health. There were even teas that the kids loved made from roses.
author: Megan B.

description:
Extremely helpful service!
We tasted and learned a lot of different tea for free.
Great selection and quality!
author: JK C.

description:
I consider my self some what of a Kung Fu Cha aficionado. Love High Mountain Tea. This place though over priced had it all. Want to try tea? Come here, sit by the bar and do it. don't forget to tip  the servers or just buy tea. Its good for your health. 

I love Ali Shan, Da Hung Pao, Puerh, Dong Ding, and Milk Oolong.
author: Eve K.

description:
I only wish I could find a place like this locally. During the Chinese Lunar New Year celebration, my girlfriend and I stumbled into Vital Tea looking for a quick cup of tea. We were treated to an hour long tasting expedition. We tried everything from the simplest green tea to the $800 / lb premium tea. 

I ended up buying the Blue People Ginseng Oolong. It is, without a doubt, the best tea I've ever tasted. Smooth, light and delicate with a great finish. 

If you love tea and you are anywhere near Chinatown, make Vital Tea a requisite stop. You won't regret it.
author: Daniel H.

description: Wonderful tea tasting in Chinatown in an authentic shop.  They are very gracious about free tastings.  The owner gave advice on medicinal use of teas.  I was facing surgery for tear duct blockage.  He recommended baby chrysanthemum tea, which I've used for 4 weeks now, a cup in the morning.  I am symptom free during the day.  Even mornings, before I use the tea, I am better.  I am going to be able to do without the surgery.  I'm thrilled with this ancient Chinese remedy and the advice I got.  Thank you!!
author: Gail W.

description:
My 11 year old niece is starting to show interest in tea and I couldn't be more thrilled. While visiting ChinaTown she stumbled into this shop and we were greeted with a smile and invited to sit for a tea sampling. This also came a long with a very funny and informative commentary from who I believe is the owner. 

We sampled many tea's and were given information on how to steep them and why they are good for our bodies. My niece was just eating up the information and enjoying trying different types of tea. 

The location is CLEAN and BRIGHT. I was so thrilled to have found this little gem. I ended up buying some Oolong and Ginseng tea, it is truly amazing. 

I WILL be coming back and bringing my tea-loving friends!
author: Meghan L.

description:
I went to Chinatown to experience the culture, and came home with a new Uncle.  My husband and I had just descended into Chinatown with a list of places we wanted to go and see.  We happened onto a tea store with an older asian gentleman barking at us to come into his tea store.  We weren't sure if he was being serious or what.  I was reluctant to go in because I had other places I wanted to go and a tea store wasn't at the top of my list.  My husband and I sat down at the tea bar and a young lady gave us many samples of various teas explaining the health benefits of each type and descriptions of the taste.  We were very fortunate that we were the only ones in the store at that particular time as we spent a while chatting with the older gentleman.  We learned that this gentleman is everyone's Uncle Gee.  We had a nice time visiting with our new uncle and listening to his words of wisdom about life ... and tea.  We purchased the Angel Green Tea and the Royal Pu-urh. We told Uncle Gee that we would tell all of our friends about his tea store and plan to order more tea from the Vital Tea Leaf website.

Thank you Uncle Gee!

"You come in as strangers, but leave as family". ~ Uncle Gee ... and with a hug
author: Julie C.

description: Jin is great at explaining about the teas and is happy to let you try as many as you want.
author: G Z.

description:
After accidently pouring coffee on my iPod earbuds I then put them in my ears, getting a jolt to my nervous system that I never thought possible. I decided that it may be time to change my poison.

Not ready or willing to kick the habit, I was 86ed from Caffeholics Anonymous and ready for my next fix.  I like tea, but the black gold is my drug of choice. I came into Vital Tea with a half open mind and the delirium tremens from my coffee withdrawl, asking for the strongest black tea. Uncle Gee and John didn't give into my demands, but did ply me with a battery of amazing teas, with many different tastes and cures for various ailments. Highly recommended are Blue Peoples for anxiety, Milk Oolong for spending money and delicious taste, Siberian Rose for a delicate sweetness, and basically anything placed in front of you.

Cheaper than going to a comedy show, they'll make you laugh and blush with assumptions about your love life and your GI tract, and by the time you leave you'll know about their's and the German tourists' sitting next to you.

And for the caffeine addicts out there, Vital Tea gives a different high, but you'll leave buzzed and satisfied nonetheless.
author: Joanna M.

description: We happened to stumble onto to this place while we were walking through China town. But it was quite a pleasant surprise. The hosts incredibly informative and entertaining. It's a definite must stop anytime you're in the area. The tea experience here is none like any other.
author: Rajat D.

description: I don't often go to tea houses, let alone review them, but this place is pretty neat. They have a great selection of teas, and most of them are decently priced. They offer you copious amounts of free tastings and the staff is quite friendly. I bought a sweet ass rabbit tea cup for five bucks and some lychee green tea. 5/5 would steep again.
author: Christopher S.

description:
Vital Tea Leaf
SF: China Town
Sunday January 2, 2011
Four Stars

I went Tea Tasting for the first time ever.  The lady was really nice and barely spoke English which I bet was a front.  We sampled:

   Lychee Black
   Jasmine
   Coconut
   White Tea

I bought the Lychee Black because it was naturally sweet and tasted fantastic.  Apparently the Lychee Black is their top seller.  I also bought a tea pot.  Everything is super cheap here.  BUY! BUY! BUY!  I went online and everything is more expensive than this place.
author: Leonard L.

description: This is the place to find quality, authentic, and unique teas. Again, this is high grade tea sold at reasonable rates. Also, everyone that works there will happily educate you on all the specific health benefits each individual tea holds. This is a true SF gem for sure.
author: Angelina N.

description:
On a random trip to Chinatown with my mother, we passed by this place. She was taking her time trying to pick out the biggest dried scallops even though they are sold by weight and are taken apart when cooked. She so crazy. 

I waited outside in the sun as I had managed to spill ice cold water all over myself twice on the drive there. The tea place was filled with white people and I texted my bf that it looks like a tourist trap and asked him to Yelp it. 4 stars. 

I drink tea every morning but I didn't get to this morning because we were supposed to leave at 10:30 and I woke up at 11:30 and we didn't leave until noon. Haha. We had some extra time to kill so we sat down and instantly this guy starts talking to us. The main guy was still talking to all the tourists. The guy serving us kept spewing out some hard core Mandarin and I had my mother translate every 15 seconds. Haha. 

He asked what kind of tea I wanted and I said Oolong. He told me he had tons and I told him I wanted the strongest and darkest one they had. He let us try two. One was too bitter and the other too sweet. I am seriously through with Oolong after 6+ negative Oolong experiences. At least this one was free. 

My mother was eyeing some white pearl tea and he let us try that too. It was okay. They he forced (in the nicest and funniest way possible) some Ginseng tea on us. Horrible. I've always hated Ginseng tea. My mother and I barely drank it and he kept pour cups of it. Haha. 

We ended up buying 1/4 pound of Baby Chrysanthemum for $20. He said he was giving us extra but I have no idea if he just says that to everyone to make it seem like we're getting a good deal. Either way when I opened the bag, it was completely packed. I'm glad it tasted great since we didn't try it in stores and I hated all the other teas we tasted. 

The whole experience was super fun. We had a blast trying all the teas and the guy helping us was really nice and funny. Not once did he pressure us into buying anything. Not even a hint! I think we got treated differently than the tourists which is a-okay with me. The best part is that its all free! There is even plates of fortune cookies for you. Of course I ate 3 before my mother took them away from me. 

Minus one star for high prices and I noticed two long hairs on two of the cups which were kind of gross.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
My roommate and I loved the free tea tasting experience at Vital Tea! Kevin and Uncle guided us through our tea journey and were very fun and informative. 

We happened here on accident actually. We found some parking while in the SF Chinatown area and Vital Tea happened to be right across from us so we decided to run in and check it out. 

Turns out Kevin was actually from Chicago too!

We liked a few of the teas we tried and ended up leaving with some of the Lychee Black tea :)
author: Rachel T.

description:
If it wasn't for the people that work there, this place would probably not be getting 5 stars.

If you like tea, want to know more about tea, know nothing about tea, or even hate tea, go to Vital Tea Leaf in Chinatown SF!

We didn't have the honor of having Uncle Gee be our host, but we got Herman and he was just as good. He speaks English, which is a plus and he was really funny! He taught us everything we needed to know about how to pour tea and what all the different kinds are.

Thing I didn't really like is they push 3 kinds of tea and you try them. If you want other kinds of tea, you end up spending a long time listening to the same shpeel over and over until you try some DragonWell or MonkeyPick!

We bought some BluePeople, because it makes your mouth water!

Go here, a lot :-)
author: Ashley T.

description: We were passing by with a box full of dim sum and we noticed a bunch of tourists laughing their butts off! We had to stop to see what was going on. It was an older man, UUUUUNNNNNCLLEEEEE, entertaining his guests! We were so mesmerized by his words of wisdom that we simply had to take a seat (which were all taken, so they grabbed us a few from the back). It was my favorite find in china town and it was a hidden gem where we could wind down, relax, laugh, and leave with a few hugs and memories (and some ginseng).
author: Cory R.

description:
I was hoping for an enjoyable tea tasting experience (and tea shopping), but it ended up being extremely annoying.

We got here and joined the bar where 6 other people were sitting. We were pretty much ignored for a good 10 minutes while the waiter just kept telling jokes to the people already there.
Even when he eventually came to us, he was obnoxious and send the vibe of "you don't look like you'll buy anything so you don't deserve my time".

After our first tasting, we waited another 15 minutes until we decided to leave.

Fortunately enough, down the street was a different place which was MUCH friendlier. And guess what, we ended up buying tea for multiple family and friends which ended up being a significant expense.

No way this place is 4.5 stars.
author: Assaf B.

description: Absolutely love this place. Stopped in tried several different kinds of tea. Learned from our very pleasant and knowledgeable hostess, may, about the intricacies of each tea. In an effort to ward off sickness, am drinking a bit of the Angel Green right now. Additionally, City Lights Bookstore happens to be close by.
author: Rikki M.

description: My wife and I went to SF Chinatown in search of teas for health, digestion, and daily use. The lady in here was very helpful, knowledgeable and great! They have a great selections of teas. Well worth the trip. We ordered two teas: Royal Puerh and the Angel Green. We also bought a tea pot soaker/container. Works great.
author: George C.

description:
walking out of Golden Gate Fortune Cookies we wandered by this place. Poking our heads in we saw a wall lined with jars of tea leafs. On the other side was a bar set up. A couple sat at the bar with two tiny tea cups. The woman who was about to serve them invited us to sit down for a quick tea tasting.

She proceeded to show us how to properly brew a cup of tea (good tea needs to be rinsed and only brewed for as little as 30 seconds). She would pour out a small amount, describe the tea, its origins, what its health benefits were, then move onto the next tea. We tried 8 or so different teas before we left. My favorite one, though it was too expensive for me to bother buying, was a freeze dried green tea. when its brewed, the tea rehydrated, and looks like freshly picked tea leafs (the women brewed it in a glass so we could see). It tasted light, and frankly amazing. 

After the tea tasting we poked around a bit. An older man ended up talking to us. He was the father of the owner of the "Bar". He was having a blast hanging out, jokingly harassing customers, telling them 'this isn't a tea shop, its a bar'. 

We walked out with some leche infused black tea and some pureh (aged tea, 8 years). They also showed us the pureh they had sitting behind the bar that was originally packaged in 1940s. Its only for special occasions, and would sell for as much as 30k if it was a full brick. I guess people get obsessive over just about anything.

In the end, we left knowing a bit more about tea and its varieties, and with some great tea.
author: David M.

description:
Our school was lucky enough today to have the owner of Vital Leaf give a Chinatown Tour to our 6th graders.  It takes a lot to get and then hold an 11 year olds' attention for several hours. Uncle Gee gets boys.  Foundation of Chinese culture!! --kids made to repeat many times: 

Family, Respect, Education, Mom & Dad I can do it!

We also stopped off and were given a Tea Tasting, which was just wonderful.  I will be back to Vital Leaf for more leisurely tasting and to buy some tea--probably the ginseng oolong.  

Thanks Uncle Gee and I will make sure our kids do write you a handwritten letter.  They will remember today many years from now.
author: ruby l.

description: Had a great time Tea-tasting here!  Feels a little overpriced, but you DO pay for quality.  Overall a nice experience and a nice environment.  Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Catherine H.

description: We were visiting our friends who live in San Francisco and they insisted we stop by here and do a tea tasting.  My husband and I are not tea drinkers, but we had the BEST time.  Maggie was extremely knowledgeable and funny.  I had a few teas that I really enjoyed, and bought some too.  It is very low pressure which I really appreciated- and we learned a lot.  A really unique experience- would highly recommend!
author: Chelsea C.

description: We ran into this place during our venture in chinatown. It was our first time tea tasting, and had a good experience. Tastings are free and staff are very knowledgeable of all teas and their benefits. Great customer service. We liked the Siberian rose tea.
author: Sabrina C.

description: A must do when in SF.  Ming was so knowledgeable, and helpful, and very friendly. What an education we got, while having fun and tasting tea like never before.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I absolutely love this tea shop. Although it can be a tad pricey, it's always fresh and genuine herbs and tea. My favorite from here are the baby roses, I always buy these to add to my fresh green tea. Mmmm....

They are always super accommodating and are more than happy to explain the history and reasoning for drinking each tea in store. They provide you with samples and don't pressure you to purchase. Just sample and relax. One of my favorite things about Chinatown.
author: Natasha S.

description:
We were walking down the street and passed by this place and the funny thing is that we didn't even notice anything about free tea tasting. The store just looked like an interesting place to browse. We got in at the right time though because there was an older couple there and the lady came up from the bathroom-more on that later.

I did not have the older gentleman that everyone else seemed to be raving about but the younger lady that was there was still pretty funny. She highlighted a couple of benefits from each tea that we sampled-the older lady kept saying how she had such bad digestive problems and any mention of digestive benefits was a cue for her to repeat how bad her GI tract was.

Anyway, I did ask if there was any tea to help me sleep and her response was that the tea helps relax but doesn't help me sleep. She said that if I wanted to sleep a bottle of whiskey would help. "Let the record show she did the 'drinky-drinky' motion." 

I did end up buying some tea and it was pretty convenient that I could buy it at any increment I wanted. I want with a quarter pound and my friend also went with a quarter pound. $20, but with multiple uses for each cup it turns out to be a pretty good value, entertainment and tea wise.
author: Ted C.

description:
Would you care for a side of tea with that pretension? 

I'm not disputing all the wonderful claims about Vital Tea Leaf. It's true! Free tea tasting. YAY!  It's true! Free fortune cookies. YAY! It's true! The staff is /super/ knowledgeable. I mean like crazy smart about tea. They were blowing my mind. BUT, the thing is, they sort of knew it too. And they kind of rubbed it in our faces that we didn't know as much about tea.

There was already a couple sampling when we sat down so we enjoyed some of their samples. Then, when the super smart tea man asked if we wanted to try anything I requested Coconut Green. He sort of made a face and I said, "Is that a bad one." He told me, "We are trying some really amazing teas here and you want to sample /that/?" He appeared annoyed and I didn't appreciate it. I'm the customer I'll try what I want to try!!

Needless to say, we bought some tea, it was good. But, I could have settled for not feeling like a failure on my way out. Thanks.
author: Tai F.

description: Had an amazing tea tasting with Chris. Learned so much, tried a lot teas and enjoyed our time there.  Also got a recommendation for lunch that was great.  They know their stuff!   Not on the traditional 'to-do' list for SanFran tourists but want a treat! So glad we stopped in.  Made our day!!
author: Kimberly W.

description: Loved the place. Went to buy some lemon ginger tea for my gf's mom. Upon asking for lemon-ginger, the gentleman told me that lemon was yin and ginger was yang. Suffice it to say, I left with lemon and ginger in different bags. I loved the hospitality so much I bought a teapot.
author: Antonio H.

description: Awesome place to discover teas and have a real tea experience who makes you travel. Great place!
author: Anais A.

description: We brought a friend of ours from France here for tea tasting in Chinatown and he said it was one of his favorite experiences he had in SF. There are so many selections of tea to taste. The servers demonstrated for us  the proper way to make and serve each tea. We were also given a history and health benefit of each tea served. I've never left after tasting here without buying some tea there.
author: Sandy D.

description:
The wife and I visited the tearoom last week and Ming spent an hour and a half with us sampling more teas than I could ever imagine... He was extremely knowledgeable and educated us on the various teas and their health benefits, as well as the subtle taste differences.  We were hoping to see Uncle Gee, but the old guy was running late and we were too hungry to wait for him.  We'll see him next time.  

We just loved the entire experience.
author: Kirk T.
